intro: Barleria laciniata, commonly known as the cut-leaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
